bottom_note:
OVERHEAD(12%): 
Project management and administration
Insurance, bonding, and regulatory compliance
Equipment, tools, and transportation
Quality control and site supervision
Business operations and support services

PROFIT(8%): 
Professional service delivery and expertise
Risk assumption and warranty obligations
Business sustainability and reinvestment
Skilled workforce development and retention

This restoration project requires the coordination of multiple specialized trades over multiple weeks. Industry standard and legal precedent establish that overhead and profit is necessary when multiple trades are reasonably required for proper restoration. Professional project management ensures proper sequencing, quality control, and timely completion while maintaining safety standards and building code compliance throughout the restoration process.

items.dec: Complete hardwood flooring replacement due to water damage, partial drywall and ceiling repairs, and full baseboard/quarter round trim replacement are required. The scope includes priming and painting of the entire living room and kitchen area, along with window blind detachment/reset and construction protection installation.

items.name: Content manipulation - small scope
items.dec: Limited content handling required for construction access and material protection during restoration work

items.name: Construction protection (comprehensive)
items.dec: Comprehensive protection measures per OSHA standards including surface protection during construction plastic sheeting/dust barriers for occupied adjacent spaces floor protection (Ram board/cardboard) for finished areas and fireplace protection to prevent damage to existing finishes and maintain safe work environment

items.name: Decorative item detach & reset
items.dec: Removal and reinstallation of wall-mounted artwork to prevent damage during construction

items.name: Install drywall 1/2"
items.dec: IRC R702.3 installation requirements with cutting allowance for proper joint placement and breakage prevention

items.name: Drywall tape and blend - seam connection
items.dec: New-to-existing drywall connections for water damage restoration

items.name: Flooring preparation work
items.dec: IRC R502.3 requires proper subfloor preparation including door casing undercut (3 EA) subfloor inspection and minor prep and transition strip installation between rooms

items.name: Install hardwood flooring
items.dec: IRC R503.1 requires proper board layout with staggered joints. 10% waste factor accounts for end cuts defective boards and proper installation pattern

items.name: Install baseboard
items.dec: Installation of baseboard trim with 10% waste factor for proper fitting and cutting allowance

items.name: Install quarter round
items.dec: Installation of quarter round trim with 10% waste factor for proper fitting and cutting allowance

items.name: Prime walls and ceiling
items.dec: IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation with PVA primer for proper paint adhesion
Only wall and ceiling priming and painting work is needed to match the color scheme with the living room/kitchen. No structural repairs are required as there is no physical damage in this area.

items.name: Prime walls and ceiling
items.dec: IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation with PVA primer for proper paint adhesion

items.name: Paint walls and ceiling (2 coats) - match living room
items.dec: Replacement materials selected to match pre-loss condition per insurance policy LKQ requirements

Partial drywall replacement with texture matching and damaged vanity replacement are the primary tasks. Baseboard installation (excluding bathtub area) and moisture-resistant primer and paint application suitable for bathroom environment are included.

items.name: Install baseboard (exclude tub area)
items.dec: Installation of baseboard trim excluding tub area with 10% waste factor

items.name: Install quarter round
items.dec: Installation of quarter round trim with 10% waste factor

items.name: Prime walls and ceiling
items.dec: IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation with PVA primer for proper paint adhesion

items.name: Paint walls and ceiling (2 coats)
items.dec: Two coat paint application for walls and ceiling

items.dec: Removal of existing baseboard trim for proper flooring installation

items.name: Flooring preparation work
items.dec: IRC R502.3 requires proper subfloor preparation including door casing undercut (1 EA) and subfloor inspection

items.dec: IRC R503.1 requires proper board layout with staggered joints. 10% waste factor accounts for end cuts defective boards and proper installation pattern

items.name: Install baseboard

items.dec: Installation of quarter round trim with 10% waste factor for proper fitting and cutting allowance
Complete hardwood flooring replacement and baseboard/quarter round replacement in the hallway connected to the bedroom. This area includes flooring replacement with associated trim work and painting.

items.dec: Removal of existing hardwood flooring for replacement

items.name: Remove baseboard
items.dec: Removal of existing baseboard trim for replacement

items.name: Remove quarter round
items.dec: Removal of existing quarter round trim for replacement

items.dec: IRC R503.1 requires proper board layout with staggered joints. 10% waste factor accounts for end cuts defective boards and proper installation pattern

items.name: Ground level hauling (1st floor)
items.dec: Hauling of construction debris from ground level work areas

items.name: Stair surcharge (2nd floor - 1 flight)
items.dec: Additional hauling cost for debris removal from second floor via stairs

items.name: Distance surcharge (>50ft)
items.dec: Additional hauling cost for debris transport over 50 feet to dumpster location

items.name: 10-yard dumpster rental (15 days)
items.dec: Dumpster rental for estimated 0.7 tons of construction debris

items.name: Permit fees (street placement)
items.dec: Municipal permit for dumpster placement on public street

items.name: Daily construction cleanup (ongoing throughout project)
items.dec: Daily cleanup of work areas to maintain safe working conditions per OSHA standards and prevent debris accumulation during multi-phase construction

items.name: Final detail cleaning (post-construction)
items.dec: Comprehensive post-construction cleaning including dust removal surface cleaning and preparation for occupancy per industry standards
